Today, Dan and Jordan go to the past, hoping to escape the rising antisemitism in the modern right wing, only to stumble into an episode that drifts heavily into similar territory. In this installment, Alex covers overzealous gunpowder storage laws, a Holocaust survivor calls in, and another caller brings up Henry Ford's favorite literature.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/10/25/episode-740-august-13-2003 Episode #740: August 13, 2003]</ref>:

*Antisemitism and homophobia were pretty regular at Infowars in 2003
*Alex and Joyce Reilly don't tell the [https://www.capecodtimes.com/story/news/2003/08/25/arnold-s-dad-was-storm/50950808007/ whole] [https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-2003-aug-14-me-father14-story.html story] about Arnold and the Simon Weisenthal Center
*Alex covers a story about [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/2003/10/29/supremacist-set-for-plea-bargain-release/0aa9c4c5-9dcb-45ee-b4de-4543f00e3f35/ a man arrested for illegally storing gunpowder], but fails to point out that he was a Nazi who was [https://www.religionnewsblog.com/4874/md-man-pleads-guilty-to-weapons-charges stockpiling gunpowder in advance of a race war] he saw coming
*Alex defends [https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2003/aug/13/race.world a racist harasser in UK] in the name of protecting free speech
*911 Truthers entirely misrepresent [https://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/matier-ross/article/Willie-Brown-got-low-key-early-warning-about-air-3314754.php the story of Willie Brown getting a warning] about flying on 9/11
*The claim that Condoleezza Rice warned Brown [http://www.911myths.com/index.php/Willie_Brown traces back to holocaust denier David Irving]
*[https://www.congress.gov/bill/105th-congress/house-bill/2431 HR 2431]
